pairs.positive: I naturally take charge in group situations and guide others toward solutions.
pairs.negative: I prefer to let others take the lead while I contribute from a supporting role.

pairs.positive: I feel responsible for ensuring that team goals are met successfully.
pairs.negative: I focus on my individual contributions rather than overall team outcomes.

pairs.positive: I enjoy mentoring others and helping them develop their skills and potential.
pairs.negative: I prefer to concentrate on my own development rather than coaching others.

pairs.positive: I'm comfortable making difficult decisions even when they're unpopular.
pairs.negative: I prefer decisions to be made collectively or by someone else in authority.

pairs.positive: I actively identify problems and create plans to address them proactively.
pairs.negative: I wait for clear instructions before taking action on potential issues.

pairs.positive: I inspire others to perform at their best and exceed their own expectations.
pairs.negative: I focus on meeting my own standards rather than motivating others.

pairs.positive: I communicate vision and direction clearly to align team efforts.
pairs.negative: I prefer to receive clear direction rather than setting it for others.

pairs.positive: I take accountability for both successes and failures of the team.
pairs.negative: I'm accountable for my own work but not responsible for others' outcomes.

pairs.positive: I delegate tasks effectively based on team members' strengths and development needs.
pairs.negative: I prefer to handle important tasks myself rather than delegating to others.

pairs.positive: I build consensus while maintaining focus on achieving key objectives.
pairs.negative: I prefer to follow established consensus rather than trying to build it.

pairs.positive: I speak up in meetings to ensure important points are addressed.
pairs.negative: I contribute to meetings when asked but rarely initiate discussions.

pairs.positive: I recognize and develop the potential in each team member.
pairs.negative: I focus on working with people as they are rather than developing them.

pairs.positive: I set high standards and help others understand how to achieve them.
pairs.negative: I adapt to existing standards rather than trying to raise them.

pairs.positive: I remain calm under pressure and help others do the same.
pairs.negative: I look to others for stability and guidance during stressful situations.

pairs.positive: I initiate changes when I see opportunities for improvement.
pairs.negative: I prefer to support changes that others initiate rather than starting them myself.

pairs.positive: I facilitate productive discussions and help resolve conflicts.
pairs.negative: I avoid getting involved in conflicts and prefer when others resolve them.

pairs.positive: I volunteer to represent the team in meetings with other departments or stakeholders.
pairs.negative: I'm more comfortable when someone else represents the team in external meetings.

pairs.positive: I create structure and processes that help the team work more effectively.
pairs.negative: I work best within existing structures rather than creating new ones.

pairs.positive: I encourage innovation and calculated risk-taking among team members.
pairs.negative: I prefer to follow proven methods rather than encouraging experimentation.

pairs.positive: I provide honest feedback to help others improve their performance.
pairs.negative: I'm uncomfortable giving feedback and prefer that managers handle performance issues.

pairs.positive: I step forward during crises to coordinate response efforts.
pairs.negative: During crises, I look to established leaders to coordinate the response.

pairs.positive: I build strong networks and relationships that benefit the entire team.
pairs.negative: I maintain professional relationships primarily for my own work needs.

pairs.positive: I champion the team's achievements and advocate for resources they need.
pairs.negative: I expect managers and designated leaders to advocate for team resources.

pairs.positive: I help team members see how their work contributes to larger goals.
pairs.negative: I focus on understanding my own role rather than explaining purpose to others.

pairs.positive: I identify and cultivate future leaders within the team.
pairs.negative: I assume that leadership development is handled by formal training programs.

pairs.positive: I make time to listen to team concerns and address them thoughtfully.
pairs.negative: I direct team members to appropriate channels when they have concerns.

pairs.positive: I establish clear expectations and hold people accountable to them.
pairs.negative: I prefer when expectations are set by formal managers or supervisors.

pairs.positive: I celebrate team victories and help maintain morale during setbacks.
pairs.negative: I participate in celebrations but don't take responsibility for team morale.

pairs.positive: I seek out challenging assignments that allow me to grow and lead others.
pairs.negative: I prefer assignments that match my current skills and comfort level.

pairs.positive: I model the behavior and work ethic I expect from others.
pairs.negative: I focus on my own performance rather than setting an example for others.

pairs.positive: I organize team efforts around shared priorities and deadlines.
pairs.negative: I rely on others to organize and coordinate team activities.

pairs.positive: I help team members balance competing priorities and workloads.
pairs.negative: I manage my own priorities and assume others can handle theirs.

pairs.positive: I invest time in understanding each person's motivations and working style.
pairs.negative: I adapt my working style to others rather than learning to motivate them.

pairs.positive: I take initiative to solve problems before they escalate.
pairs.negative: I report problems to appropriate authorities rather than solving them directly.

pairs.positive: I cultivate trust by being transparent about decisions and their rationale.
pairs.negative: I trust that leaders will share information on a need-to-know basis.
